items.q: In the board game 'Clue', which of these characters is NOT one of the original six suspects?
items.explanation: Mr. Boddy is the victim whose murder the players are trying to solve.

items.q: The PlayStation 2 remains the best-selling video game console of all time.
items.explanation: It sold over 155 million units worldwide.

items.q: In the game 'Codenames', the Spymaster gives multi-word clues to help their team guess correctly.
items.explanation: The Spymaster is strictly limited to one-word clues.

items.q: What legendary 1998 video game revolutionized 3D adventure gameplay and featured a protagonist named Link?
items.a: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time.
items.explanation: It introduced mechanics like Z-targeting that became industry standards.

items.q: Which classic bluffing card game involves getting rid of your cards by lying about what you are playing face-down?
items.explanation: If a player is caught lying, they must pick up the entire pile.

items.q: What massive online battle arena (MOBA) game created by Riot Games is one of the biggest esports in the world?
items.explanation: Two teams of five battle to destroy the opponent's core structure, the Nexus.

items.q: In tabletop gaming terminology, what does 'meeple' refer to?
items.a: A small wooden, person-shaped playing piece.
items.explanation: The term was popularized by the board game Carcassonne.

items.q: What wildly successful party game uses black cards with prompts and white cards with offensive or humorous answers?
items.explanation: It bills itself as 'a party game for horrible people'.

items.q: Which genre-defining sci-fi video game series features Commander Shepard fighting the Reapers?
items.explanation: It is famous for deep story branching based on player choices.

items.q: In a standard chess game, how many squares are on the board?
items.explanation: There is an alternating 8x8 grid of light and dark squares.
